channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report X-2024010463
item.description:
Report X-2024010463

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: EAU CLAIRE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Trailer 833861 from MILW was opened up at 01:38 during OTP sort. Immediately upon opening door metal pail rolled off end of rollers and fell out of trailer and landed on concrete. Container damaged as a result of falling and began leaking. No blocking or bracing used for any packages loaded at the edge of trailer. No load net used in trailer. DescribePack: Entire side of container dented, resulting in lid no longer being sealed DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Tipped upright, placed in black spill bin

item.title: Report E-2024010124
item.description:
Report E-2024010124

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-16T18:13:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 4, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was damaged during transit and released approximately two and a half (2.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. The damaged pail, all UN2922 impacted materials, and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal purposes.

item.title: Report X-2024010172
item.description:
Report X-2024010172

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-13
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: found the box in the hazmat cage damaged and wet. once opened found that the two plastic containers have leaked out due to not having any caps or seals on the containers. DescribePack: The containers have leaked out due to not having caps on the containers. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: all was put into the hazmat cage in a plastic spill bag and then into a black tote.

item.title: Report X-2024010191
item.description:
Report X-2024010191

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-16
  • City: SUPERIOR
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered to be leaking upon unloading it from the trailer. Package was immediately placed into a damage bucket and brought to QA for inspection and processing. DescribePack: Package was soaked through and falling apart. Bottles cap came off spilling contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a damage bin to contain spill.

item.title: Report E-2024010133
item.description:
Report E-2024010133

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-16T18:13:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: TOMAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a 15 gallon spill of UN3082 "Miramer M1142" that arrived damaged at Terminal XTM. (1) a 55-gallon metal drum was punctured by a nail in the pallet impacting Trailer. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. (1) 95-gallon poly drum containing the impacted "Oil Dri" absorbent material, the damaged drum, the remaining material, and issued PPE was created as waste and left for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010301
item.description:
Report X-2024010301

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-16T18:13:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-22
  • City: CUDAHY
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: 5 gallon steel drum of liquid taken off pickup van leaking along bottom rim DescribePack: Approximately 0.1 gallons leaked through bottom rim. Small dent visible along lower side but bottom rim not visibly displaced. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in plastic tote under ventilator
